an unreasonable complaint, especially about something that is not important: The one cavil I have about the book is that it is written as a diary. The main cavil is that the whole film goes on for too long.
More examplesFewer examplesOne slight cavil is that the author could have given more sense of the process of historical change.I cannot defend the system against all cavils or criticisms from any source.If I have any cavil with his new piece, it lies in its lack of adventurousness.
